intro: Conyza larrainiana, commonly known as the Larrain's weed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, often grouped in clusters. Conyza larrainiana is an annual herb that produces seeds readily, contributing to its widespread distribution.
